references.paper_title: Drawing as a versatile cognitive tool
references.reason: This review paper provides a comprehensive overview of the cognitive functions and applications of drawing, establishing its significance in cognitive science and informing the study of human drawing abilities.

references.paper_title: Human-level concept learning through probabilistic program induction
references.reason: This seminal paper introduced a benchmark for evaluating human-level concept learning, which has significantly influenced the development and evaluation of one-shot learning models.

references.paper_title: A simple framework for contrastive learning of visual representations
references.reason: This paper proposed a simple yet highly effective framework for contrastive learning, which has greatly advanced self-supervised learning and representation learning in computer vision and has influenced several other regularizers discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Barlow twins: Self-supervised learning via redundancy reduction
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel self-supervised learning method based on redundancy reduction, which has advanced the field of contrastive learning and is directly relevant to the redundancy reduction regularizer used in this paper.

This paper proposed the use of prototype networks for few-shot learning, which has had a significant impact on the field of few-shot learning and is directly relevant to the prototype-based regularizer used in this paper.
